article.description: Lucas Woodhouse and Akwasi Yeboah combined to score 47 points as Stony Brook snapped Brown's four-game win streak and handed the Bears a home-court loss for the first time this season with a 92-8
article.headline: Woodhouse, Yeboah spark Stony Brook past Brown, 92-89
article.linkText: Woodhouse, Yeboah spark Stony Brook past Brown, 92-89
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- Lucas Woodhouse and Akwasi Yeboah combined to score 47 points as Stony Brook snapped Brown's four-game win streak and handed the Bears a home-court loss for the first time this season with a 92-89 non-conference win Saturday afternoon. The win is the first in Providence for the Seawolves since 2000. Woodhouse topped his one-game-old career high by scoring 27 points, knocking down 5 of 8 shots from beyond the arc and converting all six free-throw attempts while dishing off five assists. Yeboah hit 4 of 6 from deep and finished with 20 points. Stony Brook had limited itself to single-digit turnovers in four of its last six games, but committed 11 against Brown. Tavon Blackmon led five Brown shooters into double-digit scoring with 19 points. Brandon Anderson added another 18 points while the Bears shot a collective 54 percent from the field (27 of 50).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
